content.html:
Function Controls

The role played by the function dial can be selected using
BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > FUNCTION (Fn) SETTING.

● EXPO. COMP.
● IMAGE SIZE
● IMAGE QUALITY
● FILM SIMULATION
● GRAIN EFFECT
● COLOR CHROME EFFECT
● COLOR CHROME FX BLUE
● DYNAMIC RANGE
● D RANGE PRIORITY
● WHITE BALANCE
● CLARITY
● FOCUS MODE
● AF MODE
● AF-C CUSTOM SETTINGS
● FACE DETECTION ON/OFF
● AF RANGE LIMITER
● SPORTS FINDER MODE
● PRE-SHOT ES Hd
● SELF-TIMER
● PHOTOMETRY


● SHUTTER TYPE
● FLICKER REDUCTION
● FLICKERLESS S.S. SETTING
● ISO
● IS MODE
● FLASH COMPENSATION
● FLASH FUNCTION SETTING
● HIGH SPEED REC
● SELF-TIMER
● BACKGROUND DEFOCUS MODE
● FIX MOVIE CROP MAGNIFICATION
● IS MODE BOOST
● PRODUCT PRIORITY MODE
● ZEBRA SETTING
● INTERNAL/EXTERNAL MIC LEVEL
ADJUSTMENT
● MOVIE OPTIMIZED CONTROL ●
● DEFAULT
● DEFAULT ( WHEN SET TO M)
● NONE

To disable the function dial, select NONE.


● If DEFAULT is selected, the role played by the function dial will be
tailored to the mode currently chosen with the mode dial ( ⌀ 7).
● If DEFAULT ( IZ WHEN SET TO M) is selected, the control will be as-
signed EXPO. COMP. instead of FILM SIMULATION when an AUTO
option is selected for ISO sensitivity in mode M (manual).

321

Shortcuts
10
